definition: The Thirty-Six Stratagems, a Chinese essay used to illustrate a series of stratagems used in politics, war, and in civil interaction/all the possible schemes and stratagems
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
Of the Thirty-Six Stratagems, fleeing is best./see also 三十六計|三十六计[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4]
pinyin: san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4

definition: see 三十六計，走為上策|三十六计，走为上策[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4]
pinyin: san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ji4

definition: lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
wind vane/anemometer/weathercock/fig. person who switches allegiance readily/turncoat
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
